articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Former President Donald Trump is demanding a new judge just days before his hush-money criminal trial is set to begin, rehashing longstanding grievances with the current judge in a long-shot, eleventh-hour bid to disrupt and delay the case.
articles.title: Donald Trump is demanding a new judge just days before the start of his hush-money criminal trial

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden on Friday wrote to the leaders of Egypt and Qatar, calling on them to press Hamas for a hostage deal with Israel, according to a senior administration official, one day after Biden called on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to redouble efforts to reach a cease-fire in the six-month-old war in Gaza.
articles.title: Biden urges Egypt, Qatar leaders to press Hamas to come to agreement for Israeli hostages in Gaza

articles.description: QUITO, Ecuador (AP) — Mexico’s president Andrés Manuel López Obrador said Friday evening the country will break diplomatic ties with Ecuador after police broke into the Mexican embassy in Quito.The announcement came after Ecuadorian police officers forcibly broke into the Mexican embassy in Quito, detaining former Ecuadorian Vice President Jorge Glas, who was seeking political asylum there, as a diplomatic rift between the two countries deepened.
articles.title: Mexico’s president says country will break diplomatic ties with Ecuador, after police raid embassy

articles.author: LEE KEATH
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — Two basic mistakes, according to the Israeli military. First, an officer overlooked a message detailing the vehicles in the convoy.
articles.title: Israel says its strike that killed aid workers was a mistake. Rights groups say it was no anomaly

articles.author: DOUG FEINBERG
articles.description: CLEVELAND (AP) — Caitlin Clark eventually found a way.Completely shut down in the first half, the most exciting player in women's college basketball now has one game left in her storied career at Iowa.
articles.title: Caitlin Clark leads Iowa rally for 71-69 win over UConn in women's Final Four. South Carolina awaits

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: DUNDALK, Md. (AP) — President Joe Biden got a firsthand look Friday at efforts to clear away the “mangled mess” of remains of the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, as cranes, ships and diving crews work to reopen one of the nation's main shipping lanes.
articles.title: Biden tours collapsed Baltimore bridge as clearing proceeds and declares 'your nation has your back'

articles.author: SEUNG MIN KIM and COLLIN BINKLEY
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden will announce his latest effort to broaden student loan relief next week for new categories of borrowers, according to three people familiar with the plans, nearly a year after the Supreme Court foiled his administration’s first attempt to cancel debt for millions who attended college.
articles.title: President Joe Biden will unveil his new plan to give student loan relief to many new borrowers

articles.author: JOSEF FEDERMAN
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — When Israel declared war against Hamas last October, it stood unified at home and enjoyed broad backing from around the world following an unprecedented attack by the Islamic militant group.
articles.title: After six months of war, Israel's isolation grows with no end in sight

articles.author: ADITHI RAMAKRISHNAN
articles.description: DALLAS (AP) — East Coast residents were jolted Friday by a 4.8-magnitude earthquake centered near Lebanon, New Jersey, with weak rumblings felt as far away as Baltimore and the Massachusetts-New Hampshire border.
articles.title: East Coast earthquakes aren't common, but they are felt by millions. Here's what to know

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD
articles.description: ROME (AP) — An international campaign to ban surrogacy received a strong endorsement Friday from the Vatican, with a top official calling for a broad-based alliance to stop the “commercialization of life.”
articles.title: Right to children or children’s rights? Surrogacy debate comes to a head in Rome
